description: This is a short hike to a couple of cascades on Whitford Brook,.  Setting off from my car, I only knew the falls were located downstream.  The contour lines did not look great on the topo map and when I got there I could see why?the place looked really flat.  Anyways I charged ahead and soon was cursing the many branches and thick evergreen patches I had to plow through.  Luckily, I decided to see what the other side of the brook had to offer and was pleasantly surprised to find an established trail.I followed it and it was a pretty good trail with just a few deadfall and some branches in the way but so much easier than the other side.  Then I got to thinking that since there was a trail, the falls must be awesome!  After passing under a cleared patch where some power lines went through, the terrain changed and I began to see some elevation changes and some boulders.  I knew I was getting close to the falls!I could hear them at this point as I was under a canopy of evergreen.  Finally after a last bend in the trail?I was finally there.  There is a series of drop at this location which are quite scenic and a big boulder in the middle of the stream covered by fern that looks like a chi pet!  The total drop of the stream here is a good 25ft but all in a series of cascades instead of one true drop.  The trail continued along the now wide stream so I suspect this may be a good fishing hole too!
directions: Highway 3 in East River.  Turn on Mersey Connector Rd and pass underneath the 103.  Continue on this road as it becomes rougher and park at the bridge where there is also a metal gate.  Walk downstream on the right hand side of the stream if you are looking downstream
title: Whitford Brook Falls
